comments:
I20060512-1600 + WTP 1.5 RC2

I copied and moved lines in WTP's HTML source editor. I could not reproduce. Nothing special to see in the UI. The document was new (outgoing CVS addition) and was saved before I started to copy/move actions.

DocumentLineDiffer is careful to never use the actual documents during re-initialization, but doesn't pay attention to the equivalence classes. This needs to be revisited after 3.2.

A fix would be too complex to attempt for 3.2 - since this only happens rarely and there is no lost work or similar, I propose to target for 3.3.

actually ... we see this in some other cases once we moved up to RC7. 

I haven't checked CVS, but did something in this area change from RC6 to RC7?

Its easy to reproduce too, with the test file in bug 102822. 

Happens, on RC7 base (plus WTP RC4) when you try to format that file. 

We discovered this because we are on the verge of fixing that bug, and we noticed wihout our proposed fix, the exception happens. Which are proposed fix (when we use a re-write session) the exception does not happen. 

So, if we apply our fix, that might fix that particular case, but ... 
I'm still concerned/interested in what would have caused this change?

hm, maybe this didn't start with RC7. I tried again with RC6 and still saw the error ... I'm not sure I have the right set up to test well, but just thought I'd make a note of it. I'm not sure the "when it started" question is that important ... I'm mostly like to know what causes it, and if we should expect it to happen in certain situations? 

Thanks.

Steps to reproduce in plain I20060807-2000:
- new workspace, new simple project
- create a new text file in the project
- in the editor, hold down the Enter key until the exception appears

Bug 148778 looks like a dup.

My trace:
